decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): L01 (LOCATION PLAN); P21 (PROPOSED PLANS); P22 (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS); P23 (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS); P24 (REV B) (PROPOSED BLOCK AND ROOF PLAN); DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT (DATED 30 JAN 2023).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to occupation of the development, an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely living/dining room and kitchen or bathroom above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document (2013).

| The residential units within 4 Allison Road shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework.

| Prior to occupation of the flats, a discreet timber screened refuse storage facility to accommodate shared bins for recycling and non- recycling shall be provided with capacity in compliance with BS5906:2005, and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| Cycle parking for five (5) bicycles shall be provided in a secure and lockable compound, prior to first occupation and shall be retained thereafter.
Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5.
subdivision_of_building: Ground and first floor flats only
description: Conversion and reconfiguration of a property from three to four self-contained residential units (additional residential unit on a ground floor); part single and part two storey rear/side extension; and provision of associated refuse and cycle storage
